Ezra warns the people in Jerusalem that God requires absolute faithfulness to the Law of Moses and the prescribed temple worship.
The future of the Israelites depends on their removal of all corrupting influences and cultures, especially the pagan practices of the Philistines, Samaritans, and Egyptians.
—Cyrus the Persian overthrew Babylon in 539 BC and issued his decree allowing the Jews to return in 538.
The return to their homeland occurred in three waves over the next one hundred years.
Ezra returned in the second group, in 457 BC.
